'''- Trichomoniasis :''' ''Trichomonas vaginalis,'' flagellate protozoan, anaerobic

- Scabies: ''Sarcoptes scabiei hominis'', sarcoptes*.

- Pediculosis of the pubis: ''Phtirius inguinalis

<nowiki>*</nowiki> its mode of transmission makes it similar to an STI, which requires research into risky behaviour and, where appropriate, screening for other STIs

question.title: What is the aetiology of Trichomoniasis?
question.description: A parasitic infection caused by Trichomonas vaginalis

option_b.title: A type of lice
option_b.description: A type of ectoparasite that infests the skin

option_c.title: A type of mite
option_c.description: A type of arachnid that infests the skin

option_d.title: A type of bacterial infection
option_d.description: A type of infection caused by a bacterium
